definition: to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

sentences.english: That "if" is big enough to imply this is a battle lost.
sentences.chinese: 那个“如果”大得足以暗指这一次输掉的战役了。

sentences.english: The "witchcraft" line referred to Franklin's imminent departure.
sentences.chinese: 这里的“巫术”散去暗指富兰克林即将离开。

sentences.english: That attacks apparently came from China does not, onto itself, implicate the Chinese government.
sentences.chinese: 这次来自中国的袭击事件并没有暗指中国政府。

sentences.english: Obama said, alluding to House Oversight Committee Chairman Darrell Issa.
sentences.chinese: 其实是暗指众议院监督委员会主席达雷尔伊萨。

sentences.english: He alluded to the problem but did not mention it.
sentences.chinese: 他暗指但没有明确指出这个问题。

sentences.english: Like many surnames, Louis Pasteur's probably once indicated a profession.
sentences.chinese: 像很多姓氏一样，巴斯德的姓氏在过去暗指专业。

sentences.english: King division north immediately become angry from embarrassment thinks blade was alluding to himself.
sentences.chinese: 王师北顿时恼羞成怒自以为刀锋是暗指本人。

sentences.english: I was angry with old Cotter for alluding to me as a child.
sentences.chinese: 我在生老考特的气，他把我暗指为小孩。

sentences.english: Vanga referred to it as ‘the third planet from the Earth’.
sentences.chinese: 万加暗指它是第三行星。

sentences.english: The red color of the military uniforms that Julien wears evokes the French army.
sentences.chinese: 于连所穿的军队制服的红色，暗指法国军队。

sentences.english: Today's geographically distributed applications no longer have an implied time.
sentences.chinese: 现在地理上分布的应用程序不再有暗指的时间了。

sentences.english: Are you insinuating that I am a liar?
sentences.chinese: 你绕来绕去是否暗指我在撒谎？

sentences.english: He's implicating our client in front of our jury.
sentences.chinese: 他在我方陪审团前暗指我方当事人有牵连。

sentences.english: Some sort of pun on the word 'tracks' may be intended.
sentences.chinese: 可能作者一语双关，用火车暗指“轨迹”。

definition: to attack someone by innuendo (idiom)/to make oblique charges/to make insinuations/to insinuate
unspoken implication (idiom)/the actual meaning of what was said
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
